energy.title: Energy
energy.description: Information and lifestyle-related tips commonly discussed in relation to daily energy levels.

tips.title: General nutritional support
tips.description: Adequate intake of essential vitamins and minerals is often discussed as part of maintaining overall vitality.

information.text: Multivitamins are sometimes used to help cover potential nutritional gaps in the diet.

tips.title: Vitamin D status awareness
tips.description: Vitamin D levels can vary based on factors such as sun exposure, diet, and geographic location.

information.text: Vitamin D status is commonly assessed in clinical settings using blood-based measurements.

tips.title: Vitamin D intake considerations
tips.description: Vitamin D is available from sunlight, food sources, and dietary supplements.

information.text: Vitamin D3 is a commonly used supplemental form and has been widely studied.

tips.title: Understanding vitamin D measurements
tips.description: Healthcare professionals may evaluate vitamin D levels over time to understand trends and changes.

information.text: Different vitamin D ranges are used clinically to interpret laboratory results.

tips.title: Vitamin and mineral balance
tips.description: Vitamins and minerals play roles in many metabolic and immune-related processes.

information.text: Vitamin D is involved in immune regulation and metabolic pathways.

tips.title: Mitochondrial nutrients
tips.description: Certain nutrients are involved in mitochondrial processes related to cellular energy production.

information.text: CoQ10 participates in energy transfer within the mitochondria.

tips.title: Cellular energy metabolism
tips.description: Cellular energy production relies on complex metabolic pathways.

information.text: NAD+ is involved in cellular metabolism and DNA maintenance mechanisms.

tips.title: Metabolic health factors
tips.description: Glucose metabolism is an important component of sustained energy levels.

information.text: Alpha-lipoic acid has been studied in relation to insulin sensitivity and antioxidant activity.

tips.title: Traditional longevity compounds
tips.description: Some traditional substances have historically been associated with vitality and resilience.

information.text: Shilajit contains fulvic acid and has been used in traditional wellness contexts.

sleepQuality.title: Sleep
sleepQuality.description: Information about sleep quality and factors that may influence rest.

tips.title: Sleep timing awareness
tips.description: Early bedtimes are commonly discussed in relation to circadian rhythm alignment.

information.text: Sleep timing has been studied in connection with melatonin cycles and recovery processes.

tips.title: Hormonal support considerations
tips.description: Magnesium is a mineral that has been studied in relation to relaxation and sleep.

information.text: Magnesium has been researched in connection with sleep quality and cortisol regulation.

tips.title: Neuroregulation compounds
tips.description: L-Theanine is an amino acid found in tea that has been studied for its calming properties.

information.text: L-Theanine has been associated with alpha brain wave activity and relaxation in research studies.

focus.title: Focus
focus.description: Information about factors that may influence focus and concentration.

tips.title: Calm alertness compounds
tips.description: L-Theanine is commonly found in green tea and has been studied for its effects on attention.

information.text: L-Theanine has been researched in relation to calm focus and reduced distraction.

tips.title: Neurotransmitter precursors
tips.description: L-Tyrosine is an amino acid that serves as a precursor to dopamine.

information.text: L-Tyrosine has been studied in relation to cognitive function during stressful conditions.

tips.title: Cognitive training approaches
tips.description: Cognitive exercises such as dual n-back and problem-solving tasks have been studied in relation to mental performance.

information.text: Mental exercises have been researched for their potential effects on working memory and neuroplasticity.

immuneSupport.title: Immune support
immuneSupport.description: Information about factors commonly discussed in relation to immune function.

tips.title: Vitamin C overview
tips.description: Vitamin C is a water-soluble vitamin found in fruits and vegetables.

information.text: Vitamin C is an antioxidant that has been studied in relation to immune cell function.

tips.title: Traditional herbal compounds
tips.description: Echinacea is an herb that has been traditionally used and studied in relation to immune health.

information.text: Echinacea has been researched for its potential effects on cold duration and immune resilience.

tips.title: Glutathione pathways
tips.description: N-acetylcysteine (NAC) is an amino acid derivative that has been studied in relation to antioxidant systems.

information.text: NAC is a precursor to glutathione, which plays a role in cellular antioxidant processes.

nervousSystem.title: Nervous system
nervousSystem.description: Information about factors commonly discussed in relation to stress management and autonomic nervous system optimization.

tips.title: Adaptogenic herbs
tips.description: Ashwagandha is an adaptogenic herb that has been traditionally used and studied in stress research.

information.text: Ashwagandha has been researched in relation to cortisol levels and stress resilience.

tips.title: Calming amino acids
tips.description: Glycine is an amino acid that functions as a neurotransmitter in the central nervous system.

information.text: Glycine has been studied for its potential calming effects and influence on sleep quality.

tips.title: Neuropeptide research
tips.description: Semax is a synthetic peptide that has been studied in neurological research contexts.

information.text: Semax has been researched for its potential effects on brain chemistry and cognitive function.

tips.title: Breathwork practices
tips.description: Practice daily breathwork (4-7-8 breathing, box breathing) to activate parasympathetic nervous system.

information.text: Controlled breathing techniques have been studied in relation to heart rate variability and stress reduction.

tips.title: Sleep optimization
tips.description: Prioritize 7-9 hours of quality sleep for nervous system recovery.

information.text: Sleep is essential for autonomic nervous system balance and restoration.

tips.title: Sunlight exposure
tips.description: Morning sunlight exposure regulates circadian rhythm and cortisol patterns.

information.text: Light exposure timing has been studied in relation to circadian rhythm entrainment.

tips.title: Cold exposure
tips.description: Cold exposure (showers, ice baths) trains ANS resilience and vagal tone.

information.text: Cold water immersion has been researched for its effects on sympathetic activation and adaptation.

tips.title: Meditation and mindfulness
tips.description: Meditation and mindfulness reduce sympathetic activation and improve HRV.

information.text: Mindfulness practices have been extensively studied in relation to stress reduction and autonomic regulation.

tips.title: Nature exposure
tips.description: Time in nature activates parasympathetic nervous system and reduces stress hormones.

information.text: Forest bathing and nature exposure have been studied for their calming physiological effects.

tips.title: Recovery monitoring
tips.description: Avoid overtraining - monitor HRV for recovery status before intense workouts.

information.text: HRV monitoring has been studied as a tool for optimizing training load and recovery.

tips.title: Social connection
tips.description: Social connection and laughter boost vagal tone and parasympathetic activity.

information.text: Social bonding has been researched in relation to vagus nerve activity and stress buffering.

tips.title: Calming music
tips.description: Listen to calming music or binaural beats to promote alpha wave activity.

information.text: Music therapy and binaural beats have been studied for their effects on brain wave patterns and relaxation.

tips.title: Adaptogenic herbs
tips.description: Adaptogenic herbs (ashwagandha, rhodiola) support ANS balance under stress.

information.text: Adaptogens have been researched for their potential to modulate stress response systems.

musclePerformance.title: Performance
musclePerformance.description: Information about factors commonly discussed in relation to physical performance.

tips.title: Energy substrate compounds
tips.description: Creatine is one of the most researched supplements in sports science.

information.text: Creatine has been extensively studied in relation to ATP production and strength performance.

tips.title: Neuromuscular training concepts
tips.description: Protein intake and neuromuscular training have been studied in sports science.

information.text: Motor unit recruitment and neuromuscular efficiency are key concepts in strength and power development research.

tips.title: Endurance-related compounds
tips.description: Beta-alanine is an amino acid that has been studied in relation to exercise performance.

information.text: Beta-alanine has been researched for its role in buffering hydrogen ions during high-intensity exercise.

tips.title: Traditional performance compounds
tips.description: Shilajit is a traditional substance containing minerals and fulvic acid.

information.text: Shilajit has been studied in some research contexts related to physical performance.

tips.title: Hormonal pathway research
tips.description: Fadogia agrestis is a plant that has been studied in preliminary research contexts.

information.text: Some research has explored Fadogia in relation to luteinizing hormone pathways.

digestiveHealth.title: Digestion
digestiveHealth.description: Information about factors commonly discussed in relation to digestive health.

tips.title: Gut microbiota overview
tips.description: Probiotics are live microorganisms that have been studied in relation to gut health.

information.text: Probiotics have been researched for their potential effects on gut microbiota balance and immune function.

tips.title: Dietary fiber sources
tips.description: Research has identified various bacterial strains in the gut. A study from Zoe identified the strain SGB15249 in individuals who consumed nuts and seeds regularly.

information.text: Nuts and seeds are dietary sources of fiber that have been studied in relation to microbiome composition.

tips.startPrompt: Analyze the image and determine if it contains what is needed for the goal 'nuts and seeds'.

tips.title: Hepatic support compounds
tips.description: Milk Thistle is an herb that contains silymarin, which has been studied in liver research.

information.text: Milk Thistle has been researched for its potential role in liver cell function and regeneration.

tips.title: Bile acid compounds
tips.description: TUDCA (tauroursodeoxycholic acid) is a bile acid that has been studied in relation to digestive processes.

information.text: TUDCA has been researched for its potential effects on bile flow and cellular health.

cardioFitness.title: Cardio fitness
cardioFitness.description: Information about cardiovascular training approaches commonly discussed in exercise science.

tips.title: High-intensity interval training
tips.description: HIIT is a training method that has been extensively studied in exercise physiology.

information.text: HIIT has been researched for its effects on VO₂ max and metabolic adaptations.

tips.startPrompt: The user has a goal to perform at least 2 high-intensity interval training (HIIT) sessions per week. Based on the workout log below, evaluate whether the goal was achieved. Summarize progress and give encouragement or advice.

tips.title: Progressive volume training
tips.description: Gradual increases in training volume are commonly discussed in running programs.

information.text: Progressive volume increases have been studied in relation to aerobic base development and injury prevention.

tips.startPrompt: The user is working to increase total running distance each week. Given the workout data, analyze if there's an upward trend. Mention any signs of overtraining or progress plateaus.

tips.title: VO₂ max monitoring
tips.description: VO₂ max is a measure of aerobic capacity that can be tracked using various fitness devices.

information.text: VO₂ max is widely recognized in exercise science as a key marker of cardiovascular fitness and endurance capacity.

tips.startPrompt: Evaluate the trend in VO2 max over the past month using the data below. Has the user improved? Offer encouragement or suggest changes to training based on results.

mind.title: Mind
mind.description: Information about heart–brain coherence and mental state exploration.

tips.title: Heart–Brain Coherence exploration
tips.description: HRV (Heart Rate Variability) can be used to observe patterns associated with different mental states.

information.text: Heart–Brain Coherence is a concept describing a state where heart rhythm patterns become smooth and sinusoidal. This phenomenon has been studied in relation to breathing techniques and emotional states.

tips.startPrompt: Complete the session according to the steps below. Then take a picture of your HRV measurement and upload it.
tips.analyzePrompt: Analyze the uploaded image: How do heart rate, HRV, and the curve pattern differ between the steps?

tasks.task1: HRV measurement in baseline (sitting still without specific mental focus).
tasks.task2: HRV measurement while focusing on a stressful or challenging thought.
tasks.task3: HRV measurement during recovery with calm breathing.
